00030 #ifndef _QUEUE_H_
00031 #define _QUEUE_H_
00032 
00033 /*
00034 *       Data item queues with unlimited and limited capacity.
00035 *       Methods for FIFO queueing are virtually as fast as programmed "by hand".
00036 *       Methods for time-sorted queueing and random access are not as optimal.
00037 *
00038 *       Unlimited queue:        class   uqueue
00039 *       Limited queue:          class   queue
00040 *                               Inherits methods from uqueue and complements them
00041 *                               with overflow check.
00042 */
00043 
00044 /*
00045 INITIALISATION
00046 ==============
00047 Class uqueue
00048 ------------
00049         uqueue::uqueue(void);
00050         Constructor. Sets current length to zero.
00051 Class queue
00052 -----------
00053         queue::queue(int mx = 0);
00054         Constructor. Sets current length to zero, limit to mx. Default mx: 0.
00055         Mx < 0 is corrected to 0 (use unlimit() afterwards).
00056 int     queue::setmax(int mx);
00057         Changes the queue limit to mx.
00058         Returns TRUE:   o.k.
00059                 FALSE:  current queue length is larger than mx, limit not changed.
00060 void    queue::unlimit(void);
00061         Deletes the capacity limitation of a queue. If possible, the class uqueue should
00062         be used instead.
00063 
00064 ENQUEUEING
00065 ==========
00066 Class uqueue
00067 ------------
00068 void    uqueue::enqueue(data *pd);
00069         Enqueues the given item at the tail of the queue.
00070 void    uqueue::enqHead(data *pd);
00071         Enqueues the given item at the head of the queue.
00072 void    uqueue::enqTime(data *pd);
00073         Enques the item in front of the first item with a time member not smaller
00074         than pd->time (creates a sorted queue with increasing time stamps). If
00075         pd->time is larger than all other times, pd is added at the tail.
00076 
00077 int     uqueue::enqPrec(data *pd, data *ref);
00078         Looks for ref and enqueues pd in front of ref.
00079         Returns TRUE:   o.k.
00080                 FALSE:  ref not found in the queue
00081 int     uqueue::enqSuc(data *pd, data *ref);
00082         Looks for ref and enqueues *pd behind ref.
00083         Returns TRUE:   o.k.
00084                 FALSE:  ref not found in the queue
00085 Class queue
00086 -----------
00087 All uqueue methods are also available for queue. They first check on overflow and then
00088 call uqueue's method. All methods return int:
00089         FALSE   on overflow or unsuccesssfull uqueue method,
00090         TRUE    otherwise.
00091 
00092 DEQUEUEING
00093 ==========
00094 Classes uqueue and queue
00095 ------------------------
00096 data    *(u)queue::dequeue(void);
00097         Dequeues and returns the item at the front. An empty queue returns NULL.
00098 data    *(u)queue::deqTail(void);
00099         Dequeues and returns the item at the tail. An empty queue returns NULL.
00100 data    *(u)queue::deqTime(tim_typ tim);
00101         Dequeues and returns the first item with a time member not smaller than tim.
00102         Returns NULL if no appropriate item found.
00103 data    *(u)queue::deqThis(data *pd);
00104         Dequeues the specified item. Returns pd if found in the queue, otherwise NULL.
00105 
00106 INFORMATION
00107 ===========
00108 Classes uqueue and queue
00109 ------------------------
00110 int     (u)queue::isEmpty(void);
00111         Returns TRUE if queue is empty, FALSE otherwise.
00112 int     (u)queue::isQueued(data *pd);
00113         Returns TRUE if *pd is queued, FALSE otherwise.
00114 int     (u)queue::getlen(void);
00115         Returns the current queue length.
00116 
00117 data    *(u)queue::first(void);
00118         Returns the item which would be returned by queue::deq(), but does
00119         *not* actually dequeue it. Returns NULL in case the queue was empty.
00120 data    *(u)queue::last(void);
00121         Returns the last item of the queue. It is *not* dequeued.
00122         Returns NULL if the queue was empty.
00123 
00124 data    *(u)queue::sucOf(data *pd);
00125         Returns the item behind the specified one. Returns NULL if pd not
00126         found or pd is the last item of the queue.
00127 data    *(u)queue::precOf(data *pd);
00128         Returns the item in front of the specified one. Returns NULL if pd not
00129         found or pd is the first item of the queue.
00130 
00131 int     (u)queue::resCursor();
00132         Initializes the internal cursor for subsequent calls of getNext(). Returns
00133         TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise (queue empty).
00134 data    *(u)queue::getNext();
00135         Each call returns the pointer to the next data object queued. Returns NULL,
00136         if end of queue reached. The first call returns the front of the queue.
00137         Prior to the first call of getNext(), resCursor() *has to*
00138         be called. If resCursor() wasn't successful, getNext() *must not* be called.
00139         Between resCursor() and all subsequent calls of getNext(), no enqueueing
00140         or dequeueing actions are allowed.
00141 
00142 Class queue
00143 -----------
00144 int     queue::isFull(void);
00145         Returns TRUE if queue is full, FALSE otherwise.
00146 int     queue::getmax(void);
00147         Returns the current queue limit. In case unlimit() was called in advance,
00148         -1 is returned.
00149 
00150 Private methods
00151 ===============
00152 data    *uqueue::findPrec(data *pd);
00153         Looks for the preceedor of the specified item. If found, the preceedor's
00154         address is returned. Otherwise NULL.
00155 data    *uqueue::findPrecTime(tim_typ tim);
00156         Looks for the preceedor of the first item with a time member not smaller than tim.
00157         If found, the reference is returned. Otherwise NULL.
00158 
00159 Implementation details
00160 ======================
00161 Implementation is optimized for the limited FIFO queue. Since a q_len counter is maintained
00162 anyway, extra marking of the last item by next == NULL is omitted. On the other hand, unlimited
00163 and sorted queues are probably a little bit slower.
00164 Using a complete data struct as head (from which actually only next is used) eases operations:
00165 the head does not need "special treatment".
00166 
00167 */
00168 
00169 
00170 /***************************************************************************************
00171 *
00172 *       Queue with unlimited capacity
00173 *
00174 ***************************************************************************************/
00175 //tolua_begin
00176 class   uqueue  {
00177 public:
00178         inline  uqueue(void)
00179         {       q_len = 0;
00180         }
00181 
00182         inline  void    enqueue(data *pd)
00183         {       if (q_len++ == 0)
00184                         q_head.next = q_last = pd;
00185                 else
00186                 {       q_last->next = pd;
00187                         q_last = pd;
00188                 }
00189         }
00190         inline  void    enqHead(data *pd)
00191         {       if (q_len++ == 0)
00192                         q_head.next = q_last = pd;
00193                 else
00194                 {       pd->next = q_head.next;
00195                         q_head.next = pd;
00196                 }
00197         }
00198         inline  void    enqTime(data *pd)
00199         {       data    *p;
00200                 // do not inc q_len until call of findPrecTime() !
00201                 if ((p = findPrecTime(pd->time)) == NULL)
00202                         // queue empty or new largest time.
00203                         // See remark three lines above.
00204                         enqueue(pd);
00205                 else
00206                 {       // it is sure: p can't be the last item
00207                         pd->next = p->next;
00208                         p->next = pd;
00209                         ++q_len;
00210                 }
00211         }
00212 
00213         inline  int     enqPrec(data *pd, data *ref)
00214         {       data    *p;
00215                 if ((p = findPrec(ref)) == NULL)
00216                         return FALSE;
00217                 ++q_len;
00218                 // sure: p can't be the last item (ref follows)
00219                 p->next = pd;
00220                 pd->next = ref;
00221                 return TRUE;
00222         }
00223         inline  int     enqSuc(data *pd, data *ref)
00224         {       if (isQueued(ref) == FALSE)
00225                         return FALSE;
00226                 // q_len must be at least 1 (since ref was found)
00227                 ++q_len;
00228                 if (ref == q_last)
00229                 {       // ref was the last, add at tail
00230                         q_last->next = pd;
00231                         q_last = pd;
00232                 }
00233                 else
00234                 {       // include after ref
00235                         pd->next = ref->next;
00236                         ref->next = pd;
00237                 }
00238                 return TRUE;
00239         }
00240 
00241         inline  data    *dequeue(void)
00242         {       if (q_len-- == 0)
00243                 {       q_len = 0;
00244                         return NULL;
00245                 }
00246                 data    *pd = q_head.next;
00247                 q_head.next = pd->next;
00248                 return pd;
00249         }
00250         inline  data    *deqTail(void)
00251         {       return deqThis(q_last);
00252         }
00253         inline  data    *deqTime(tim_typ tim)
00254         {       data    *p, *p2;
00255                 if ((p = findPrecTime(tim)) == NULL)
00256                         return NULL;
00257                 if ((p2 = p->next) == q_last)
00258                         // dequeue from tail
00259                         q_last = p;
00260                 else    p->next = p2->next;
00261                 --q_len;
00262                 return p2;
00263         }
00264         inline  data    *deqThis(data *pd)
00265         {       data    *p;
00266                 if ((p = findPrec(pd)) == NULL)
00267                         return NULL;
00268                 if (pd == q_last)
00269                         // dequeue from tail
00270                         q_last = p;
00271                 else    p->next = pd->next;
00272                 --q_len;
00273                 return pd;
00274         }
00275                 
00276         inline  int     isEmpty(void)
00277         {       return q_len == 0;
00278         }
00279         inline  int     isQueued(data *pd)
00280         {       int     i;
00281                 data    *p = q_head.next;
00282                 for (i = 0; i < q_len; ++i)
00283                 {       if (p == pd)
00284                                 return TRUE;
00285                         else    p = p->next;
00286                 }
00287                 return FALSE;
00288         }
00289 
00290         inline  int     getlen(void)
00291         {       return q_len;
00292         }
00293         inline  data    *first(void)
00294         {       return q_len == 0 ? (data *) 0 : q_head.next;
00295         }
00296         inline  data    *last(void)
00297         {       return q_len == 0 ? (data *) 0 : q_last;
00298         }
00299         inline  data    *sucOf(data *pd)
00300         {       if ( !isQueued(pd) || pd == q_last)
00301                         return NULL;
00302                 return pd->next;
00303         }
00304         inline  data    *precOf(data *pd)
00305         {       data    *p2;
00306                 if ((p2 = findPrec(pd)) == NULL || p2 == &q_head)
00307                         return NULL;
00308                 return p2;
00309         }
00310 
00311         inline  int     resCursor()
00312         {       if (q_len == 0)
00313                         return FALSE;
00314                 iterCursor = &q_head;
00315                 return TRUE;
00316         }
00317         inline  data    *getNext()
00318         {       if (iterCursor == q_last)
00319                         return NULL;
00320                 iterCursor = iterCursor->next;
00321                 return iterCursor;
00322         }
00323 //tolua_end
00324 protected:
00325         //      ATTENTION:
00326         //      These methods return the pointer to q_head if the desired
00327         //      item is the first of the queue. So do not use from outside.
00328         inline  data    *findPrec(data *pd)
00329         {       int     i;
00330                 data    *p = &q_head;
00331                 for (i = 0; i < q_len; ++i)
00332                 {       if (p->next == pd)
00333                                 return p;
00334                         else    p = p->next;
00335                 }
00336                 return NULL;
00337         }
00338         inline  data    *findPrecTime(tim_typ tim)
00339         {       int     i;
00340                 data    *p = &q_head;
00341                 for (i = 0; i < q_len; ++i)
00342                 {       if (p->next->time >= tim)
00343                                 return p;
00344                         else    p = p->next;
00345                 }
00346                 return NULL;
00347         }
00348 
00349 //      the current length is not private, since it is sometimes exported for displaying.
00350 //tolua_begin
00351 public:
00352         int     q_len;
00353         //tolua_end
00354 protected:
00355         data    *q_last;
00356         data    q_head;
00357         data    *iterCursor;    // for getNext()
00358 };//tolua_export
00359 
00360 /***************************************************************************************
00361 *
00362 *       Queue with limited capacity
00363 *
00364 ***************************************************************************************/
00365 //tolua_begin
00366 class   queue: public uqueue    {
00367 public:
00368         inline  queue(int mx = 0)
00369         {       q_max = mx;
00370                 if (q_max < 0)  // to set unlimited mode, use unlimit() or use uqueue
00371                         q_max = 0;
00372         }
00373         inline  int     setmax(int      mx)
00374         {       if (mx < q_len)
00375                         return FALSE;
00376                 q_max = mx;
00377                 return TRUE;
00378         }
00379         inline  void    unlimit(void)
00380         {       q_max = -1;
00381         }
00382 
00383         inline  int     enqueue(data *pd)
00384         {       if (q_len == q_max)
00385                         return FALSE;
00386                 if (q_len++ == 0)
00387                         q_head.next = q_last = pd;
00388                 else
00389                 {       q_last->next = pd;
00390                         q_last = pd;
00391                 }
00392                 return TRUE;
00393         }
00394         inline  int     enqHead(data *pd)
00395         {       if (q_len == q_max)
00396                         return FALSE;
00397                 if (q_len++ == 0)
00398                         q_head.next = q_last = pd;
00399                 else
00400                 {       pd->next = q_head.next;
00401                         q_head.next = pd;
00402                 }
00403                 return TRUE;
00404         }
00405         inline  int     enqTime(data *pd)
00406         {       if (q_len == q_max)
00407                         return FALSE;
00408                 uqueue::enqTime(pd);
00409                 return TRUE;
00410         }
00411                 
00412         inline  int     enqPrec(data *pd, data *ref)
00413         {       if (q_len == q_max)
00414                         return FALSE;
00415                 return uqueue::enqPrec(pd, ref);
00416         }
00417         inline  int     enqSuc(data *pd, data *ref)
00418         {       if (q_len == q_max)
00419                         return FALSE;
00420                 return uqueue::enqSuc(pd, ref);
00421         }
00422 
00423         inline  int     isFull(void)
00424         {       return q_len == q_max;
00425         }
00426         inline  int     getmax(void)
00427         {       return q_max;
00428         }
00429         //tolua_end
00430 protected:
00431         int     q_max;
00432 }; //tolua_export
00433 #endif
